cyclone.name: GORDON
cyclone.current_location: about 280 miles ESE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the north-central Gulf Coast (LA–MS–AL)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Mississippi-Alabama coast between the Mouth of the Pearl River and the AL/FL border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch west of Shell Beach LA to the Mouth of the Mississippi River and east of Dauphin Island AL to Navarre FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Mouth of the Pearl River to the Alabama-Florida Border; Tropical Storm Warning west of Mouth of Pearl River to east of Morgan City LA and Alabama-Florida Border to Okaloosa-Walton County Line
weather_observation.impacted_coast: southeastern Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama, and the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Brief squalls with gusts 30–40 mph possible Monday while center pulled away
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side of Florida
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of tropical downpours Monday with rapid tapering thereafter
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents along South Florida beaches
